metadata.title: Portuguese Placement Test - Dual Assessment (Comprehension + Production)
metadata.description: Complete 180-question test covering all 90 curriculum units with both comprehension and production assessment
metadata.structure: Interleaved comprehension (PT→EN) and production (EN→PT) questions for each unit

phases.name: Foundation (A1)
phases.description: Absolute beginner - basic identity, present tense

phases.name: Upper-Intermediate (B2)
phases.description: Upper-intermediate - subjunctive, advanced grammar, colloquial speech

scoring.comprehensionOnly: Can understand but not produce - needs speaking/writing practice
scoring.both: True mastery - can understand AND produce
scoring.placementLogic: Last unit where BOTH comprehension AND production passed

questions.question: What does 'Eu sou professor' mean?
How do you say: 'I am Brazilian'
What does 'do' mean in 'Eu sou do Brasil'?

questions.en: I am from the United States
questions.question: How do you say: 'I am from the United States' (use 'dos Estados Unidos')
Which definite article is correct? '__ livros estão na mesa' (the books are on the table)
How do you say: 'The girls are here' (use 'meninas' for girls, 'estão' for are, 'aqui' for here)
questions.hint: Remember: 'meninas' is feminine plural, so use 'as'

questions.pt: Eu tenho um carro e uma casa
questions.question: What does 'Eu tenho um carro e uma casa' mean?
questions.correct: I have a car and a house
options: I have a car and a house
I have the car and the house
I want a car and a house
I am a car and a house

questions.en: I have a dog and a cat
questions.question: How do you say: 'I have a dog and a cat' (use 'cachorro' for dog, 'gato' for cat)
questions.correct: Eu tenho um cachorro e um gato
alternatives: Eu tenho uma cachorra e uma gata

questions.question: What does 'Eu estou no trabalho' mean?
How do you say: 'I am at home'
questions.hint: Use 'estar' for location, 'em casa' (no contraction for 'casa')

questions.question: Which is correct? 'A casa __'
How do you say: 'The small books' (use 'pequeno' for small)
Complete the sentence: 'Eu __ em São Paulo' (morar - to live)
How do you say: 'I live in Rio' (use the verb 'morar')
Complete the sentence: 'Eu __ português' (falar - to speak)
How do you say: 'I speak Spanish' (use the verb 'falar')
What does 'no' mean in 'Eu trabalho no banco'?
How do you say: 'I work at the hospital' (use 'hospital' and the verb 'trabalhar')
Complete the sentence: 'Eu __ português' (estudar - to study)
How do you say: 'I study English' (use the verb 'estudar')

questions.unitName: Verb Ficar (to be located / to stay)
questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'A escola __ perto' (ficar - to be located)

questions.unitName: Verb Ficar (to be located / to stay)
questions.question: How do you say: 'The bank is far' (use 'banco' for bank, 'longe' for far, verb 'ficar')
questions.hint: Conjugate 'ficar' for 'o banco' (3rd person singular): fica

questions.question: What does 'Eu estou cansado' mean?
How do you say: 'I am happy' (use 'feliz' for happy)
questions.hint: Use 'estar' for temporary states like emotions

questions.question: How do you say 'I'm at work' in Portuguese?
How do you say: 'I am at school' (use 'escola' for school)
What does 'Meu pai e minha mãe' mean?
How do you say: 'My brother and my sister' (use 'irmão' for brother, 'irmã' for sister)
What does 'Eu não falo inglês' mean?
How do you say: 'I don't live in Brazil' (use the verb 'morar')
What does 'Eu tenho um carro' mean?
How do you say: 'I have a house' (use 'casa' for house)

questions.unitName: Age with Ter (Eu tenho X anos)
questions.question: What does 'Eu tenho 25 anos' mean?

questions.unitName: Age with Ter (Eu tenho X anos)
questions.question: How do you say: 'I am 30 years old' (use 'trinta' for 30)
questions.hint: In Portuguese, you 'have' years, not 'are' years old

questions.question: What does 'Você fala português?' mean?
How do you say: 'Do you live in Brazil?' (use the verb 'morar')
questions.hint: Same word order as statement, add question mark

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'Eu preciso __ ajuda' (precisar de - to need)
How do you say: 'I need money' (use the verb 'precisar de' and 'dinheiro' for money)
What does 'Eu como arroz e feijão' mean?
options: How I eat rice and beans

questions.question: How do you say: 'I eat meat and salad' (use 'carne' for meat, 'salada' for salad, verb 'comer')
questions.hint: Use the verb 'comer' (to eat), conjugated for 'eu': como

questions.question: What does 'Eu bebo água' mean?
How do you say: 'I drink coffee' (use 'café' for coffee, verb 'beber')
questions.hint: Use the verb 'beber' (to drink), conjugated for 'eu': bebo

questions.question: What does 'Eu como pão' mean?
How do you say: 'I eat fruit' (use 'fruta' for fruit, verb 'comer')
Complete: 'Ele __ português' (falar)
How do you say: 'She speaks English' (use the verb 'falar')
What does 'Nós falamos português' mean?
How do you say: 'We live in Brazil' (use the verb 'morar')
Complete the sentence: 'Eu gosto __ música' (gostar de - to like)
How do you say: 'I like coffee' (use the verb 'gostar de')
Complete the sentence: 'Eu __ a porta' (abrir - to open)
How do you say: 'I open the window' (use 'janela' for window, verb 'abrir')
What does 'Eu vou viajar amanhã' mean?
questions.correct: I am going to travel tomorrow
options: I am going to travel tomorrow

questions.en: I am going to study today
questions.question: How do you say: 'I am going to study today' (use 'hoje' for today)
questions.hint: Use 'ir' + infinitive for near future: vou + estudar

questions.question: What does 'Eles falam português' mean?
How do you say: 'They work here' (use the verb 'trabalhar')
What does 'amanhã' mean?
How do you say: 'I studied yesterday' (use the preterite tense of 'estudar')

questions.unitName: Common Question Words (Onde, O que, Quando)
questions.question: What does 'Onde você mora?' mean?

questions.unitName: Common Question Words (Onde, O que, Quando)
questions.question: How do you say: 'What do you eat?' (use the verb 'comer')
questions.hint: Use 'O que' for 'what', then subject + verb

questions.question: Why is it 'meu carro' but 'minha casa'?
questions.correct: Carro is masculine, casa is feminine
options: Carro is masculine, casa is feminine
Carro is singular, casa is plural
Carro is mine, casa is yours
Carro is new, casa is old

questions.question: How do you say: 'My book and my pen' (use 'livro' for book, 'caneta' for pen)
What does 'Seu livro' mean?
How do you say: 'Your car' (use 'carro' for car)
What does 'Nossa casa' mean?
How do you say: 'Our car' (use 'carro' for car)
What does 'Eu falei com ela ontem' mean?
options: I used to speak with her

questions.question: How do you say: 'I worked yesterday' (use the verb 'trabalhar')
What does 'Eu comi arroz' mean?
How do you say: 'I drank water' (use the verb 'beber')
What does 'Eu fui ao Brasil' mean?
How do you say: 'I was a teacher' (use 'professor/professora')
What does 'Eu tive uma reunião' mean?
How do you say: 'I was at home' (use the preterite of 'estar')
What does 'Eu fiz o trabalho' mean?
How do you say: 'I said everything' (use the verb 'dizer' and 'tudo' for everything)
What does 'Eu vi o filme' mean?
How do you say: 'I came here' (use the verb 'vir')
What does 'Eu pude ir' mean?
How do you say: 'I wanted to go' (use the verb 'querer')

questions.unitName: Contractions with Preposition A (ao, à, aos, às)
questions.question: What does 'ao' mean in 'Vou ao mercado'?

questions.unitName: Contractions with Preposition A (ao, à, aos, às)
questions.question: How do you say: 'I'm going to the park' (use 'parque' for park, verb 'ir')
questions.hint: Use contraction 'ao' (a + o) because 'parque' is masculine

questions.pt: Viajo para o Brasil por duas semanas
questions.question: What does 'Viajo para o Brasil por duas semanas' mean?
questions.correct: I travel to Brazil for two weeks
options: I travel to Brazil for two weeks
I travel from Brazil for two weeks
I travel through Brazil in two weeks
I travel around Brazil by two weeks

questions.question: How do you say: 'I work for my family' (use 'família' for family)
questions.hint: Use 'para' when expressing purpose or beneficiary

questions.pt: Eu tenho vinte e cinco anos
questions.question: What number is 'vinte e cinco'?
How do you say: 'I have forty-five students' (use 'alunos' for students)
questions.correct: Eu tenho quarenta e cinco alunos

questions.question: What does 'mil' mean?
How do you say: 'It costs two hundred reais' (use the verb 'custar')
What does 'Eu morava em São Paulo' mean?
questions.correct: I used to live in São Paulo
options: I used to live in São Paulo
I will live in São Paulo

questions.question: How do you say: 'I used to speak French' (use the verb 'falar')

questions.unitName: Imperfect Tense - Irregular Verbs (ser, ter, vir)
questions.question: What does 'Eu era jovem' mean?
questions.correct: I was young / I used to be young
options: I was young / I used to be young

questions.unitName: Imperfect Tense - Irregular Verbs (ser, ter, vir)
questions.question: How do you say: 'I had a dog' (use the imperfect of 'ter')

questions.pt: João é mais alto que Pedro
questions.question: What does 'João é mais alto que Pedro' mean?
options: João is as tall as Pedro
João is less tall than Pedro

questions.question: How do you say: 'Maria is shorter than Ana' (use 'baixa' for short/short-in-height)
questions.correct: Maria é mais baixa que Ana
alternatives: Maria é mais baixa do que Ana

questions.pt: Ele é o mais alto da classe
questions.question: What does 'Ele é o mais alto da classe' mean?
questions.correct: He is the tallest in the class
options: He is the tallest in the class
He is taller than the class
He is very tall in class
He is as tall as the class

questions.en: She is the smartest in the class
questions.question: How do you say: 'She is the smartest in the class' (use 'inteligente' for smart)
questions.correct: Ela é a mais inteligente da classe
questions.hint: Use 'a mais inteligente' because the subject is feminine

questions.question: What time is 'São três horas'?
How do you say: 'It's one o'clock'
questions.hint: Use singular 'é' and 'uma hora' for 1 o'clock

questions.question: What does 'segunda-feira' mean?
How do you say: 'Today is Friday'
What does 'Meu aniversário é em junho' mean?
How do you say: 'I travel in December' (use the verb 'viajar')
What is special about saying the 1st of the month?

questions.en: Today is the first of January
questions.question: How do you say: 'Today is the first of January'
What does 'Moro no terceiro andar' mean?
questions.correct: I live on the third floor
options: I live on the third floor
I live on the four floor
I live in the third apartment

questions.en: I live on the second floor
questions.question: How do you say: 'I live on the second floor' (use 'andar' for floor)
What does 'Faz calor hoje' mean?
How do you say: 'It's cold today'
Where does the color adjective usually go in Portuguese?
How do you say: 'The blue house' (use 'azul' for blue)
questions.hint: Color adjectives typically go after the noun

questions.question: What is notable about 'calça' (pants) in Portuguese?
questions.correct: It's singular, not plural like English
options: It's singular, not plural like English

questions.question: How do you say: 'I wear black pants' (use 'calça' for pants, 'preta' for black, verb 'usar')
What does 'Minha cabeça dói' mean?
How do you say: 'My arm hurts' (use 'braço' for arm, verb 'doer')
questions.hint: Use 'doer' (to hurt), conjugated for 3rd person: dói

questions.question: What does 'Meus avós' mean?
How do you say: 'My uncle lives here' (use 'tio' for uncle)

questions.pt: Eu estou feliz / Eu tenho fome
questions.question: What do these sentences mean? 'Eu estou feliz' and 'Eu tenho fome'
questions.correct: I am happy / I am hungry
options: I am happy / I am hungry
I am happy / I have food
I stay happy / I have hunger
I feel happy / I want food

questions.question: How do you say: 'I am sad' (use 'triste' for sad)

questions.pt: O livro está em cima da mesa
questions.question: What does 'em cima de' mean?

questions.en: The book is under the table
questions.question: How do you say: 'The book is under the table' (use 'embaixo de' for under)
questions.correct: O livro está embaixo da mesa

questions.question: What does 'Minha casa tem três quartos' mean?
How do you say: 'My house has two bathrooms' (use 'banheiro' for bathroom)
What does 'Eu acordo às sete horas' mean?
options: I go to bed at 7 o'clock

questions.en: I go to bed at ten o'clock
questions.question: How do you say: 'I go to bed at ten o'clock' (use 'deitar' for go to bed, 'dez horas' for ten o'clock)
questions.correct: Eu me deito às dez horas
questions.hint: Use reflexive 'me deito' or just 'deito', with 'às' for time

questions.pt: Eu sempre estudo / Eu nunca trabalho aos domingos
questions.question: What do these sentences mean?
questions.correct: I always study / I never work on Sundays
options: I always study / I never work on Sundays
I often study / I rarely work on Sundays
I study forever / I don't work on Sundays
I am studying / I never worked Sundays

questions.question: How do you say: 'I sometimes eat meat' (use 'às vezes' for sometimes)
questions.hint: Às vezes can go before or after the subject

questions.pt: Eu gosto de arroz e feijão
questions.question: What is 'arroz e feijão' in Brazilian culture?
How do you say: 'I like chicken and potatoes' (use 'frango' for chicken, 'batata' for potato)
questions.correct: Eu gosto de frango e batata
alternatives: Eu gosto de frango e batatas

questions.question: What is the exception to using 'de' with transportation?
How do you say: 'I go on foot'

questions.pt: Eu jogo futebol / Eu toco piano
questions.question: What do these sentences mean?
questions.correct: I play soccer / I play piano
options: I play soccer / I play piano
I like soccer / I touch piano
I watch soccer / I study piano
I practice soccer / I have a piano

questions.question: How do you say: 'I watch movies' (use 'assistir' for watch, 'filme' for movie)
What does 'Eu ligo para você' mean?
How do you say: 'I send a message' (use 'mandar' or 'enviar' for send, 'mensagem' for message)
What does 'Quanto custa?' mean?
How do you say: 'How much is this?' (use 'isto' for this)

questions.pt: Eu sou professor / Ela é médica
questions.question: What do these sentences mean?
questions.correct: I am a teacher / She is a doctor
options: I am a teacher / She is a doctor
I am the teacher / She is the doctor
I work as teacher / She works as doctor
I have a teacher / She has a doctor

questions.question: How do you say: 'I am a doctor' (use 'médico/médica')
questions.hint: Use 'ser' for professions, no article needed

questions.question: What does 'Eu estou doente' mean?
How do you say: 'I have a fever' (use 'febre' for fever)
What does 'Fale português!' mean?
How do you say: 'Eat the food!' (use 'comida' for food, imperative of 'comer' for você)

questions.pt: Este livro é meu, esse carro é seu, aquela casa é dela
questions.question: What does this sentence mean?
questions.correct: This book is mine, that car is yours, that house (over there) is hers
options: This book is mine, that car is yours, that house (over there) is hers
This book is mine, this car is yours, this house is hers
The book is mine, the car is yours, the house is hers
These books are mine, those cars are yours, those houses are hers

questions.question: How do you say: 'This car is mine' (use demonstrative 'este' for this)
questions.hint: Use 'este' for things close to you

questions.question: What does 'Na sala tem um sofá' mean?
questions.correct: In the living room there's a sofa
options: In the living room there's a sofa
The living room has a sofa
I have a sofa in the room
The sofa is in the room

questions.en: In the bedroom there's a bed
questions.question: How do you say: 'In the bedroom there's a bed' (use 'quarto' for bedroom, 'cama' for bed)
What does 'Eu tenho um cachorro' mean?
How do you say: 'I have a cat' (use 'gato/gata' for cat)
What does 'Eu estudo matemática e história' mean?
options: I study the math and the history

questions.question: How do you say: 'I study Portuguese and English'
questions.hint: Use verb 'estudar', no articles before languages

questions.question: What does 'Eu falarei com você amanhã' mean?
questions.correct: I will speak with you tomorrow
options: I will speak with you tomorrow
I am going to speak with you tomorrow
I would speak with you tomorrow

questions.question: How do you say: 'I will travel next year' (use future tense of 'viajar', 'ano que vem' for next year)
questions.correct: Eu viajarei no ano que vem

questions.question: What does 'Gostaria de um café' mean and why is this form used?
questions.correct: I would like a coffee (polite request)
options: I would like a coffee (polite request)

questions.question: How do you say: 'I would like to travel' (use conditional of 'gostar')

questions.pt: Onde é que você mora? / O que é que você quer?
questions.question: What do these questions mean?
questions.correct: Where do you live? / What do you want?
options: Where do you live? / What do you want?
Where is it that you live? / What is it that you want?
Where were you living? / What did you want?
Where are you going? / What do you have?

questions.question: How do you say: 'What do you do?' (use emphatic 'é que' construction with 'fazer')
questions.correct: O que é que você faz?
questions.hint: Use 'O que é que' for emphasis (or just 'O que')

questions.pt: Vou à praia às três horas
questions.question: What does 'Vou à praia às três horas' mean?
questions.correct: I'm going to the beach at 3 o'clock
options: I'm going to the beach at 3 o'clock
I go to the beach for three hours
I went to a beach at three hours
I will go the beach by three o'clock

questions.en: I'm going to the store at five o'clock
questions.question: How do you say: 'I'm going to the store at five o'clock' (use 'loja' for store, 'cinco horas' for five o'clock)
questions.correct: Vou à loja às cinco horas
alternatives: Eu vou à loja às cinco horas
questions.hint: Use crase: à (a + a) before feminine nouns, às before time

questions.pt: Todo dia eu estudo / Tudo bem?
questions.question: What do these sentences mean?
questions.correct: Every day I study / Everything okay?
options: Every day I study / Everything okay?
All day I study / All is well?
The whole day I study / Is everything good?
Each day I studied / Was everything okay?

questions.question: How do you say: 'Every week I study' (use 'toda' with 'semana')
What does 'Espero que ele fale português' mean?
options: I expect that he spoke Portuguese
I hope that he will speak Portuguese
I wait for him to speak Portuguese

questions.question: How do you say: 'I hope she studies' (use present subjunctive of 'estudar')

questions.pt: Espero que você fale português / Espero que ele coma bem
questions.question: What do these sentences mean?
questions.correct: I hope you speak Portuguese / I hope he eats well
options: I hope you speak Portuguese / I hope he eats well
I hope you spoke Portuguese / I hope he ate well
I expect you to speak Portuguese / I expect him to eat well
I wait for you to speak Portuguese / I wait for him to eat well

questions.question: How do you say: 'I hope they eat well' (use present subjunctive of 'comer')
What is the present subjunctive of 'estar' for 'você'?
How do you say: 'I hope you are happy' (use present subjunctive of 'estar')

questions.pt: Se eu fosse rico, eu viajaria
questions.question: What does 'Se eu fosse rico, eu viajaria' mean?
questions.correct: If I were rich, I would travel
options: If I were rich, I would travel
If I was rich, I traveled
When I am rich, I will travel
Because I am rich, I travel

questions.en: If I had money, I would buy a car
questions.question: How do you say: 'If I had money, I would buy a car' (use imperfect subjunctive of 'ter' and conditional of 'comprar')
questions.correct: Se eu tivesse dinheiro, compraria um carro
alternatives: Se eu tivesse dinheiro, eu compraria um carro

questions.pt: Quando eu tiver tempo, vou viajar
questions.question: What does 'Quando eu tiver tempo, vou viajar' mean?
questions.correct: When I have time, I will travel
options: When I have time, I will travel
When I had time, I traveled
If I have time, I would travel
While I have time, I am traveling

questions.question: How do you say: 'When you arrive, call me' (use future subjunctive of 'chegar', imperative of 'ligar')
alternatives: Quando você chegar, ligue para mim
questions.hint: Future subjunctive of 'chegar': chegar; imperative: ligue

questions.question: What is the formal version of 'Cê tá indo pra casa?'

questions.en: Are you going to the beach?
questions.question: How do you say: 'Are you going to the beach?' in colloquial Brazilian Portuguese (use contractions)
What does 'esta semana' mean?
How do you say: 'This month' (use 'mês' for month)
What function does 'então' serve in 'Então, você vai viajar?'
How do you say: 'So, what do you think?' (use 'então' as discourse marker, verb 'achar')
questions.hint: Use 'então' at the beginning as a discourse marker

questions.question: What does 'Está para chover' mean?
How do you say: 'It's about to start' (use the idiom 'estar para' with 'começar')

questions.pt: Se eu tivesse estudado mais, teria passado no exame que foi ontem. Agora, espero que eu possa tentar de novo no mês que vem.
questions.question: This sentence integrates how many different tenses/moods?
questions.correct: 5 (imperfect subjunctive, conditional, preterite, present subjunctive, present)
options: 5 (imperfect subjunctive, conditional, preterite, present subjunctive, present)

questions.en: If I could go, I would travel to Brazil next month
questions.question: How do you say: 'If I could go, I would travel to Brazil next month' (use imperfect subjunctive of 'poder', conditional of 'viajar')
questions.correct: Se eu pudesse ir, viajaria para o Brasil no mês que vem
alternatives: Se eu pudesse ir, eu viajaria para o Brasil no mês que vem
